item.description:
Zenna Noodle for dinner at 5:00 pm and discussion of the awards season (culminating with the Academy Awards on February 27)

and

The King's Speech on the BIG SCREEN at The Coolidge Corner Theater, 290 Harvard Street, Brookline, MA.

Perhaps you've already seen The King's Speech, I have, but this is a film that has made history.  The director, writer, cinematographers, actors, editors, designers, crews, gaffers et al exceed the sum of their parts.  Even more amazing is that its not the only film nominated this year that has done so.  Still, we can only see one film at a time and this one is playing in one of our favorite venues.

Peter Travers writes in Rolling Stone:

The King's Speech plays out on the battlefield of words, not action. Writer David Seidler (doing keenly insightful work partly owing to his own bouts with a stammer) had conceived the story first as a play. Before you can think the words "static" and "confining," be advised that director Tom Hooper, garlanded with Emmy dust for John Adams, Elizabeth I, Longford and Prime Suspect, breathes fresh, urgent life into every frame of this powerhouse. Hooper, 37, is a prodigious talent. The emotion this film produces is staggering.

If you do not plan to come to both dinner and the film, please let me know your exact plans.  Probably a good idea to purchase tickets earlier in the day.

Please note also that RSVPs stop at 3:00 pm to give Zenna Noodle consideration in accommodating us.    

SYATM, Betsey
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be there with my red meet up sign and red pocketbook!
item.why: Let's go out Sunday night and meet at Zenna Noodle to eat and talk about the sensational choices for the top Oscar Categories this year, then go to see The King's Speech, one of the major contenders, but by no means the only one.
item.name: The King's Speech 6:50 pm and Dinner/Oscar Talk 5:00 pm February 20, 2011
